title: Chocolate flapjacks
content: Lovely for a lunchbox treat, these flapjacks have plenty of slow-burning carbs to keep you going through the afternoon

title: Spicy chicken cacciatore
content: With a tub of homemade tomato sauce in the fridge, this dish is a cinch

title: Sugar-crunch fruitcake
content: Moist fruit and a crunchy sugary topping mean it's impossible to have just one slice of this delicious cake

title: Apple, pear & cherry compote
content: Great as an easy dessert for Sunday lunch, then use for breakfasts and midweek puds

title: Fuss-free lasagne
content: Take advantage of the special offers available on mince and batch-cook this sure-fire family winner

title: Creamy salmon with chunky ratatouille
content: This recipe is designed to be made ahead and frozen - individual fish suppers with creamy salmon and chunky veg

title: Cheeseburger & chips
content: Homemade burgers and chips beat shop-bought every time. Why not make double and freeze a batch?

title: Friday night fish pie
content: Everyone loves a fish pie. Lulu Grimes shares a delicious, easy recipe to pop in the freezer for those busy nights

title: Italian cottage pie
content: Add a little 'mamma mia' to a beef stew with pancetta and oregano, and a crunchy topping of Parmesan-coated potatoes...

title: Bean & sausage hotpot
content: Warm up after work with this ultimate comfort food dish, just add a buttery dollop of mash

title: Balsamic steaks with peppercorn wedges
content: Freeze single portions of sirloin steak and chips so you have a home-cooked meal within minutes of getting home

title: Beef & pickle pasties
content: Bake pickle or chutney into traditional Cornish shortcrust pastry parcels to save serving on the side

title: Faggots with onion gravy
content: Made from pork shoulder and pigs liver, meatball-like faggots are a blast from the thrifty past - serve with mashed potatoes

title: Beef with red wine & carrots
content: Use this winter stew as a 'master recipe' - eat half, then use the rest in a pie or with pasta

title: Pappardelle with beef
content: Wide ribbons of pappardelle are the classic pasta to serve with a meaty sauce - you're bound to be going back for seconds

title: Tomato sauce
content: A good tomato sauce has countless uses. Make a big batch, then use in other dishes throughout the week

title: Cheese & bacon lasagne
content: This freezable, family-friendly recipe is economical and has a wonderful comfort-food feel about it

title: Honey crunch granola with almonds & apricots
content: Vary the flavour of your cereal by adding whatever nuts, seeds and dried fruit you like

title: Multi mince
content: Use this great mince recipe as a base for bolognese or cottage pie - freeze a batch ready to whip out for last-minute dinners

title: Quick cottage pie
content: A quick cottage pie that uses low-fat buttermilk in the mash

title: Rhubarb & custard crunch
content: Kids will enjoy assembling these little pots. If rhubarb isn't your thing, any cooked or canned fruit works well

title: Chilli Marrakech
content: If you love spicy, aromatic dishes like tagine, this one-pot will become an instant favourite - it uses lean lamb mince but beef also works

title: Cinnamon pancakes with compote & maple syrup
content: American-style pancakes make a special weekend breakfast. You can even make the batter the night before
